intro: Anisolotus subpinnatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are usually pink or red in color. Anisolotus subpinnatus is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
